ValueDomain.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Status Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004_A condition or state at a particular time._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.: The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.
This gene plays a role in apoptosis, inflammation, septic shock, and wound healing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Absence of clinically detectable disease including normal HCG and AFP and normalization of previously abnormal radiographic studies for at least one month
Continued absence of all disease after a complete response to a previous line of therapy
No measurable disease, but tumor markers elevated
Less than 50 percent reduction in disease or tumor markers.

Greater than or equal to 50 percent reduction in the sum of the perpendicular diameters of measureable lesions for greater than or equal to 1 month and/or greater than or equal to 50 percent reduction in tumor markers

New lesions that prove to be viable cancer and/or rise in the pretreatment tumor markers and/or greater than 25 percent increase in measurable lesions that are related to
progressive viable cancer
Tumor regression not fulfilling the requirement for partial response or tumor progression less than 25 percent increase in the bidimensionally measurable tumor parameters
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Best Outcome of Therapy Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Status Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Having the most positive qualities.:The result of therapy for a given disease or condition in a patient or group of patients.:A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004:A condition or state at a particular time.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: The result of therapy for a given disease or condition in a patient or group of patients.

A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.
A condition or state at a particular time.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
